issue_title: [Feature] Add priority level field to Todo model

verification_commands: uv run ruff check src/flywheel/todo.py src/flywheel/cli.py src/flywheel/formatter.py

acceptance_criteria: Todo dataclass has a priority: int = 1 field (0=low, 1=medium, 2=high, 3=urgent)
Todo.set_priority(level: int) method updates priority and updated_at timestamp
Todo.from_dict() validates priority is 0-3, defaults to 1 (MEDIUM)
CLI supports todo add --priority high 'task' and todo prioritize <id> <level>
TodoFormatter displays priority indicator: [!] 1 task for high priority
summary: Add priority field to Todo model with LOW=0, MEDIUM=1, HIGH=2, URGENT=3 enum values, defaulting to MEDIUM. Includes set_priority() method, from_dict() validation, CLI --priority flag and prioritize command, and formatter display.
